fact_check_explanation_title: Covid-19 vaccines are not being used to treat strep A or scarlet fever
fact_check_explanation_summary: In a Facebook video, Chris Preddie made a number of inaccurate claims about the Covid-19 vaccines.

fact_check_explanation_title: Facebook post about missing autistic boy and his dog is a hoax
fact_check_explanation_summary: The post includes a picture of a boy who it says is from Derbyshire and called Brayden. In fact the picture shows an American boy called Kai seven years ago.

fact_check_explanation_title: Instagram post misrepresents study linking climate change and diseases
fact_check_explanation_summary: Research linking climate change to strokes, dementia and migraines is not a cover up for Covid-19 vaccine harms, as Instagram user claims.

fact_check_explanation_title: Image of dog ‘hit by truck’ in Worthing was taken in 2018
fact_check_explanation_summary: Image of dog ‘hit by truck’ in Worthing was taken in 2018

fact_check_explanation_title: Buzz Aldrin didn’t ‘admit’ he never went to the Moon
fact_check_explanation_summary: A clip from a 2015 interview has been liked more than 40,000 times on Instagram.

fact_check_explanation_title: Excess deaths would be higher without Covid-19 vaccines
fact_check_explanation_summary: Dr Aseem Malhotra told the BBC that mRNA vaccines were “a likely contributing factor” to excess deaths in the UK. But the vaccines will have limited them, by preventing tens …

fact_check_explanation_title: Claim ‘nine in 10’ teachers voted to strike is misleading
fact_check_explanation_summary: Teaching union NASUWT claimed that nine in 10 of its members voted to strike.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake appeal to identify woman in ‘coma’ circulating on Facebook
fact_check_explanation_summary: A social media post falsely claims an unidentified young woman was “mugged, stabbed and left for dead on the roadside”.

fact_check_explanation_title: Diane Abbott misquotes statement from Michelle Donelan
fact_check_explanation_summary: A tweet from the Labour MP implies the opposite of what the culture secretary actually said.

fact_check_explanation_title: Fake post about child ‘missing’ after baseball practice circulating online
fact_check_explanation_summary: A post about an allegedly missing child named Tyler Miller in Lincoln has been shared on social media using a picture of an Australian girl.

fact_check_explanation_title: A 7pm sunset in the UK is more than 39 days away
fact_check_explanation_summary: The sun will set after 7pm when the clocks go forward on 26 March.

fact_check_explanation_title: Public opinion in Scotland does support EU membership
fact_check_explanation_summary: Alister Jack told the House of Commons that there is “no desire in Scotland” for EU membership. Opinion polls suggest otherwise.
